primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God reaches out to the helpless and ungodly through Christ to provide the water of eternal life, bypassing human merit.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, however, has deliberately gone into this bad neighborhood.
He reaches out especially to those who are outcast and downtrodden, and he transforms them.
the water that I shall give him will become in him a spring of water welling up to eternal life
God shows his love for us in that while we were yet sinners Christ died for us.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Ungodly / The Hearer / The Sinner
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord’s wonderful message today is for every one of us.
while we were still sinners Christ died for us.

helper.identificatie: The Word / The Holy Spirit (implied in the 'Living Water')
tekstueel_bewijs: The water that Jesus gives is his own self, his own divine life.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Human Pride / Social Barriers / Moralism
tekstueel_bewijs: original sin, an ailment that afflicts every human being
we all divide up people into classes and groups
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a universal ailment ('Big Trouble') that renders the human subject 'helpless'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformed life of the believer (the Samaritan woman, the Durrs) acting in Christlike ways.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (as a result of receiving the Object)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is a direct consequence of the primary; the woman becomes a missionary only after receiving the water.

voorbeelden_god_subject: He reaches out especially to those who are outcast.
God shows his love for us.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I looked down at my child’s hands.
The woman left her water jar.

voorbeelden: It doesn’t mean that you should keep your hands washed.
We won’t want to set ourselves up against others.
I knew I was in Big Trouble.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (ability) and the total 'Pouvoir' of Christ to save the helpless.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Psalm 24), moves to ~S1 (trying to wash hands), falls to ~S2 (realizing helplessness), and is rescued by S1 (Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies the space of S2 (Judgment/Death) to bring the ~S2 (Helpless) into S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'Big Trouble' of sin is presented as insurmountable by human effort.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God/Christ as the active Subject of salvation while the human is the passive, helpless Receiver.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I knew I could achieve clean hands.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: While we were still helpless, Christ died for the ungodly.
Original sin, an ailment that afflicts every human being.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical and historical figures are used to show God's action or the fruit of grace, not as models for imitation to earn salvation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The woman is a trophy of grace, not a hero of faith.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and gratitude; removal of the burden of performance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Perfectly integrated; the ethical examples (civil rights) are shown as the 'spring of water' flowing out of the primary gift.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'clean hands' of the Law and the 'helplessness' of the Gospel.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit (Water) becomes a spring within, granting new competence.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It identifies the human as 'helpless' and God as the sole 'Subject' of the rescue operation.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon correctly uses Devoir only to expose the need for Pouvoir.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a profound example of the 'Grammar of Grace.' It avoids all moralistic traps by keeping the focus on Christ's finished work for the ungodly.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the civil rights anecdotes, semiotics reveals these are 'secondary programs' dependent on the 'primary actant' (Christ).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Semiotics shows how the sermon moves the hearer from the 'Subject' position of Psalm 24 to the 'Receiver' position of Romans 5.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas's model exposes that even when the preacher talks about her own childhood, she is deconstructing the 'Subject' role of the human to make room for God.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Linda Tripp' and 'Monica Lewinsky' references to ground the 'Opponent' (Sin) in contemporary reality without losing the cosmic scale.
